meanings.definition: To recover from illness or exertion.
meanings.sent1: After being sick, she needed to rest and recuperate at home.
meanings.sent2: It is important to give your body time to recuperate after a long workout.
meanings.sent3: The tired puppy decided to take a nap to help him recuperate.
meanings.sent4: Her mind needed to recuperate from the stress of the exam.
meanings.sent5: The flowers will recuperate with some water and sunlight.

meanings.sent1: He hoped to recuperate quickly so he could play with his friends again.
meanings.sent2: The athlete needed to rest in order to recuperate and perform well in the next game.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's superpowers helped him recuperate from any injury.
meanings.sent4: The old car needed some time to recuperate before it could run smoothly again.
meanings.sent5: The patient followed the doctor's advice to help her body recuperate faster.

meanings.definition: To recover from financial loss or setback.
meanings.sent1: The company needed to cut costs to recuperate from the financial loss.
meanings.sent2: It took time for the business to recuperate after the economic downturn.
meanings.sent3: The piggy bank needed to recuperate after being emptied for the vacation fund.
meanings.sent4: The stock market needed to recuperate from the sudden drop in prices.
meanings.sent5: The family had to make a budget to help them recuperate financially.
